quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Diana and Princess Diana
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, people, diana. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Where is Princess Diana buried?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Althorp Park

questions.question: Who were Princess Dianas parents?

options.text: The Earl and Countess of Althorp
The Duke and Duchess of Althorp

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Viscount and Viscountess Althorp

questions.question: What was Princess Dianas job prior to her marriage?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: teachers assistant

questions.question: Princess Dianas sister dated Prince Charles, before Diana and Charles became engaged.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Franklin Delano Roosevelt became the first U.S. President to serve more than two terms.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Princess Diana had no American ancestors.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: President Theodore Roosevelt walked Eleanor down the aisle on her wedding day.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Princess Diana of Wales was actually born on one of the royal estates.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Franklin as President was best remembered for implementing this program, which many believe ended the Great Depression.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The New Deal

questions.question: Theodore Roosevelts first wife, Alice, and his mother, Martha, died on the same day.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Both Theodore Roosevelt and Franklin D. Roosevelt were democrats.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Princess Diana had one brother and one sister.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The teddy bear toy is named after former president Theodore Roosevelt.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Throughout her husbands presidency, Eleanor Roosevelt often ranked higher in popularity polls than Franklin did.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What spot became the unofficial memorial of Princess Diana in Paris?

options.text: The fountains at La Place du Trocadero
The small Statue of Liberty on an island in the Seine
The replica of the Torch of the Statue of Liberty on the Place dAlma

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The replica of the Torch of the Statue of Liberty on the Place dAlma

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Eponym and Word
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, people, theodore. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Franklin Delano Roosevelt is one of the presidents depicted on Mount Rushmore in South Dakota.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Freddie Prinze died in 1977 of a drug overdose.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of the following people did NOT die from either an intentional or accidental gun shot wound?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jonathan Brandis

questions.question: Who is the author of the self-help book How to Win Friends and Influence People?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dale Carnegie

questions.question: This author, often referred to as The Father of Science Fiction, wrote the novel The War of the Worlds.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Herbert George Wells

questions.question: This eponym comes from the name of a mentally slow character  from a cartoon by E.C. Segar, the man who drew Popeye.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: goon

questions.question: Eleanor Roosevelt wrote a bi-monthly newspaper column called New in Washington.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This eponym comes from the name of a humorous character from the writings of Teddy Roosevelts VP, Charles W.G. Fairbanks.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: blurb

questions.question: We know that a scrooge is a miserly, unhappy person. From which Dickens novel do we get this word?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Christmas Carol

questions.question: We get the word bikini from the name of a tiny atoll in the Pacific.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: He was a Greek who talked incessantly. This got on Zeus nerves so the talkative one was imprisoned  under a fruit tree. Whenever he tried to get one of the fruits, the fruit moved away from him. What was his name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tantalus

questions.question: Who created the fictional character Big Brother?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Orwell

questions.question: Singer Aaliyah was killed in a car crash in 2001.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: An atlas is a collection of maps. Where do we get the word atlas from?

options.text: The name of a Greek god

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The name of a Greek god

questions.question: Which state was admitted into the union during Theodore Roosevelts presidency?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oklahoma

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: President and U.s.
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, genius, inauguration. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these presidents only wore suits that he custom tailored himself?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrew Johnson

questions.question: This U.S. president gave the longest inauguration speech ever to that date.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Henry Harrison

questions.question: Which U.S. president published more than 16 books during his life?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Herbert Hoover

questions.question: We get this term for a type of clothing from the royal name of  J.T. Brudnell, a famous British cavalry officer .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: cardigan

questions.question: This president battled chronic stomach pain throughout his life, worsening during the time of his presidency.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Calvin Coolidge

questions.question: It is said that this president was a genius, who could write in Greek with his left hand and in Latin with his right at the same time.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Garfield

questions.question: Which U.S. president fathered 15 children: 8 with his first wife and 7 with his second wife?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Tyler

questions.question: Which of these U.S. presidents died of throat cancer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ulysses S. Grant

questions.question: Which U.S. president had his jaw removed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grover Cleveland

questions.question: The Ritz cracker gets its name from Cesar  Ritz, a famous German hotel owner.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This type of fruit gets its name from the name of an Australian fruit breeder.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Granny Smith apple

questions.question: Which president used to go skinny dipping on warm nights?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Quincy Adams

questions.question: Which president was engaged once but never married, making him the first U.S. president never to have been married when elected President of the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Buchanan

questions.question: This U.S. president survived gall bladder surgery when he was 17 years of age.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James K. Polk

questions.question: Abraham Lincoln carried bills, his mail, and personal notes in his hat.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: History Quiz: President and Us
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, supporters, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which US President was largely responsible for forming the international coalition that drove Saddam Hussein out of Kuwait in the Gulf War in the early 1990s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Bush

questions.question: President Calvin Coolidge had a special bathtub made just for him.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: He was a peanut farmer from Plains Georgia, a governor of Georgia and a graduate of the US Naval Academy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Carter

questions.question: Which U.S. president was related to 11 former presidents by blood or marriage?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: FDR

questions.question: Which US President was elected to four presidential terms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin Roosevelt

questions.question: He will be remembered for positive accomplishments in foreign affairs, especially for improving relations between the United States and China. But he will also be remembered for the scandal that forced him to be the first President to resign from office.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Nixon

questions.question: He was the first Roman Catholic US President and his father was a prominent businessman.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Kennedy

questions.question: Which of the following US Presidents was NOT the governor of a state before becoming President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Nixon

questions.question: This U.S. president married his girlfriend just 3 months after meeting her.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George W. Bush

questions.question: In his 1916 presidential campaign for reelection, his supporters said he kept us out of war, but in his second term he led the US into World War One. He was only the second Democrat elected to the Presidency since the American Civil War.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Woodrow Wilson

questions.question: Who was the only US President in the 20th century who served as a US Army general before he became President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dwight Eisenhower

questions.question: He first became famous in Hollywood. As President he sometimes got his speech lines a little confused, but he went a long way with his friend Gorbachev toward ending the Cold War.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald Reagan

questions.question: He had to make some tough decisions, such as whether or not to drop the atomic bomb on Japan. But he seldom shied away from decisions or defending his policies. He was reelected in one of the biggest political upsets in US presidential history.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Truman

questions.question: Who was the only 20th century US President who was not elected as President or Vice-President by the people of the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gerald Ford

questions.question: He was the first Vice-President in the twentieth century to become President after the death of a President. Later he was reelected for a four-year term on his own and proved to be one of the most progressive Republican Presidents in the 20th century.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Theodore Roosevelt

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Man and Egypt
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, egypt. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This World War 2 general rushed to Belgium to rescue the 101st airborn.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George S. Patton

questions.question: Queen Cleopatra the Seventh was an ancient Egyptian ruler of what nationality?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Greek

questions.question: This woman, born into slavery, worked on the underground railroad and was a Union spy during the U.S. Civil War.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harriet Tubman

questions.question: This man served as U.S. President and was the primary writer of the Constitution.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Madison

questions.question: This first lady saved a portrait of George Washington while the British burned the White House during the War of 1812.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dolley Madison

questions.question: King Akhenaten led a religious revolution in Egypt when after proclaiming that Aten (the sun disc) was the the only god. This made him and his wife extremely hated among the Egyptians and possibly led to his death (even though there is no evidence supporting the theory about unnatural death). What was the name of his chief wife?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nefertiti

questions.question: The term Pharaoh derives from the Egyptian words Pr-Aa meaning this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great House

questions.question: Who was the first person to set foot on the moon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neil Armstrong

questions.question: This man was a Confederate general but his loyalties almost always lied with the United States. He distinguished himself in the Mexican-American War and in the American Civil War.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert E. Lee

questions.question: This man was a famous inventor and an American founding father.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benjamin Franklin

questions.question: This Civil War general led the march from Atlanta to Savannah.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William T. Sherman

questions.question: This pharaoh ruled Egypt for more than 66 years and had many wives and children (according to some sources, he had as many as 200 sons and 200 daughters). The most famous of his wives was Nefertari.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rameses II

questions.question: Thutmose III is considered to have been a great military expert.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This man wrote pamphlets such as Common Sense and the Rights of Man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Paine

questions.question: This man, who was a key figure in the Reagan administration, was involved in the Iran-Contra Affair.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oliver North

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Words and History
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, egypts, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Whose dying words supposedly were I should never have switched from Scotch to martinis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Humphrey Bogart

questions.question: Khufu was a pharaoh of Ancient Egypts Old Kingdom from approximately 2589 BC to 2566 BC. He is most famous for building this monument.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Great Pyramid of Giza

questions.question: Tutankhamun succeeded Akhenaten when he was just 8 (this is true). He adopted Akhenatens monotheistic ideas and strengthened the cult in Aten.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Whose last words were reported to have been Tomorrow I shall no longer be here.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nostradamus

questions.question: The last words of what great 20th century writer were: Does nobody understand?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Joyce

questions.question: Whose final words are quoted here: I have offended God and mankind because my work did not reach the quality it should have.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leonardo Da Vinci

questions.question: Which witty prolific writer met death with these words: Either that wallpaper goes, or I go.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oscar Wilde

questions.question: What were the last words of the eloquent English romantic poet Lord Byron?

options.text: I am still in love with life and words.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Good night

questions.question: After the team of Howard Carter opened the tomb of King Tutankhamen, some of the archaeologists died in strange circumstances. This sparked the rumor of the Curse of the Pharaohs (this is true). However, Sir Arthur Conan Doyle (the inventor of the Sherlock Holmes) rejected the idea and proved it was groundless.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: There is evidence that incestuous marriage was widespread at some point of Egyptian history. For example, Maatkare Hatshepsut, regarded as the earliest known queen regnant in history, married Thutmose II.   What was her relationship to Thutmose II?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was her half-brother

questions.question: What was the last word of Alexander Graham Bell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Whose last words were: Thomas Jefferson survives.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Adams

questions.question: Joseph Turner, the great English impressionist is reported to have said which of these words just before he died?

options.text: Wait - just one more brush stroke

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sun is God

questions.question: What were the last words of Malcolm X?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lets cool it brothers

questions.question: Ancient Egypt was actually divided into two kingdoms- Upper and Lower Egypt. The cobra was one of the symbols of Upper Egypt. What kind of animal was the symbol of Lower Egypt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vulture
